column9: The concept of a "syllable" is slightly different in Chinese compared to English. While English syllables can have complex consonant clusters, Chinese syllables are generally simpler, consisting of an initial consonant (optional), a vowel, and a final consonant (optional). Be aware that tones play a significant role in distinguishing syllables in Chinese.
